title.narrative: The Third International Young Leaders Academy: „Youth Participation in Politics: Challenges and Opportunities“

description.narrative: Third year in a row International Young Leaders Academy gathers youth from East Partnership countries in pursuit to encourage discussion about democracy and cooperation. Every year young leaders meet experts, i.e. politicians from Lithuania and foreign countries, academicians and other guests, who share their experience and participate in discussions with participants. The main activities of the Academy involve lectures, discussions and seminars that provide with necessary knowledge and skills and offer new ideas. The international training focuses on strengthening democracy, active citizenship and youth leadership. The aim of Young Leaders Academy is to establish and spread democracy in Eastern Partnership countries within the youth dimension in order to build friendly democratic neighbourhood in the region and strengthen cooperation. The coming International Young Leaders Academy regarding youth participation in politics will take place on October 8-10, 2014 at the Seimas of the Republic of Lithuania. Lithuanian politicians Agne Bilotaite, Mantvydas Bekesius, Juras Pozela and others will be invited to share their experience and insight with 40-50 participants from Eastern Partnership countries, Poland, Russia and Taiwan, who are recommended by the foreing partners.
